EV isolated method:
Exosomes were isolated and characterized from conditioned media of chorionic villi as previously described [23,24]. Briefly, samples were centrifuged at 300×g for 10 min, 2000×g for 10 min, and 12000×g for 20 min; 2000×g for 30 min, and 12000×g for 45 min to remove whole cells and debris for Cchorionic villous (V-)conditioned media. The resultant supernatant fluid was passed through a 0.22-μm sterile filter (Steritop™, Millipore, Billerica, MA, U.S.A.) and then centrifuged at 100000×g for 120 min (Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc., Asheville, NC, U.S.A., Sorvall, SureSpin™ 630/36, tube angle: 900). The pellet was resuspended in PBS (500 µl, pH 7.4), layered on the top of a discontinuous iodixanol gradient containing 40% (w/v), 20% (w/v), 10% (w/v), and 5% (w/v) iodixanol solutions made by diluting a stock solution of OptiPrep™ (60% (w/v) aqueous iodixanol from Sigma–Aldrich) and centrifuged at 100000×g for 20 h. Twelve individual fractions were collected, diluted in PBS, and centrifuged at 100000×g for 2 h. Finally, the pellet for each fraction was resuspended in 50 µl of PBS and stored at −80°C.
